body_html: A new checkpoint format was introduced in 0.12. CheckpointReader was updated to be backwards compatible. The way it appears to determine if it should use the new checkpoint reader is if there's a name.index file. Does /tmp/cnn/00000001/checkpoint.index exist on your hard drive? If so, how do you think it got there?
body_text: A new checkpoint format was introduced in 0.12. CheckpointReader was updated to be backwards compatible. The way it appears to determine if it should use the new checkpoint reader is if there's a name.index file. Does /tmp/cnn/00000001/checkpoint.index exist on your hard drive? If so, how do you think it got there?
body: A new checkpoint format was introduced in 0.12. `CheckpointReader` was updated to be backwards compatible. The way it appears to determine if it should use the new checkpoint reader is if there's a name.index file. Does `/tmp/cnn/00000001/checkpoint.index` exist on your hard drive? If so, how do you think it got there?
